In my experience, the AI for Gladiator is dumb enough that this wouldn't be 
a problem. I've never had a team member mind controlled, even against some 
NASTY archmages... the kind who hit you once with lightning and kill you 
instantly. Also, I've never had a team member killed by chain lightning, 
mostly because on the higher levels I just use a single archmage or archer 
to power my way through. I've never known a computer-controlled archmage to 
summon... come to think of it, I've never seen a computer-controlled cleric 
do anything but magic mace and that glimmering wall-thing. The main problems 
with your suggestion are 1) regular lightning bolts, they pack a punch, and 
2) freeze time. In save-the-NPC levels, freeze time is a killer, but my 
understanding is that you're working on kill-em-all levels. The mages tend 
to use up a lot of their magic freezing time at the beginning, then 
basically stop doing it. If you can keep from getting hit with lightning 
through that first period, you're safe. In other words, kill the ghosts as 
quickly as possible, then get to a hidey-hole and let the mages wear 
themselves out. Also, keep your characters fast enough to outrun lightning, 
and keep the armor way up (I shoot for ten times the experience level).
     -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
